abstract: Jon Pareles Critic's Notebook observes that 2015 South By Southwest Music Conference, while presenting usual whirl of performances, promotions and deal-making, has cut down on spotlight glare enough to let new performers shine through; notes emphasis on hip-hop and dance music, persistence of indie rock and cultural element of unique foreign acts.
lead_paragraph: SXSW, with less corporate blare and celebrity swanning than in recent years, offers the promise of a stray festival encounter for musicians can bring new opportunities.

headline.main: At SXSW, Stepping Back to Allow Hopeful Artists to Step Up
headline.print_headline: Stepping Back to Allow Hopeful Artists to Step Up

snippet: SXSW, with less corporate blare and celebrity swanning than in recent years, offers the promise of a stray festival encounter for musicians can bring new opportunities.

keywords.value: South by Southwest Music and Media Conference
